intro: Sanvitalia abertii, commonly known as the desert gazania, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss. Sanvitalia abertii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
